bin/tsp.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Traveling Salesman Problem solver.
00003  *
00004  * Solves the traveling salesman problem (TSP) on the given input file.  This
00005  * is really nothing more than a wrapper to Concorde, and is for testing
00006  * purposes only.  Use Concorde's executable for access to solve options.
00007  *
00008  * @author  John LaRusic
00009  * @ingroup bin
00010  ****************************************************************************/
00011 #include "arrow.h"
00012 #include <getopt.h>
00013 
00014 /**
00015  *  @brief  Prints help/usage message.
00016  */
00017 void 
00018 print_help();
00019 
00020 /**
00021  *  @brief  Prints version message.
00022  */
00023 void 
00024 print_version();
00025 
00026 /**
00027  *  @brief  Prints usage message.
00028  */
00029 void 
00030 print_usage();
00031 
00032 /**
00033  *  @brief  Reads program arguments.
00034  */
00035 void 
00036 read_args(int argc, char *argv[]);
00037 
00038 /* Program options */
00039 char *program_name;             /**< Program name */
00040 char *input_file;               /**< Given input TSPLIB file */
00041 
00042 /****************************************************************************
00043  * Function implemenations
00044  ****************************************************************************/
00045 int 
00046 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00047 {   
00048     /* Read program arguments */
00049     program_name = argv[0];
00050     read_args(argc, argv);
00051         
00052     /* Try and read the problem file and its info */
00053     arrow_problem problem;
00054     if(!arrow_problem_read(input_file, &problem))
00055     {
00056         arrow_print_error("Could not read input file.\n");
00057     }
00058     
00059     /* Solve TSP */
00060     arrow_tsp_result result;
00061     if(!arrow_tsp_result_init(&problem, &result))
00062         arrow_print_error("Could not initialize result structure.\n");
00063     
00064     if(!arrow_tsp_exact_solve(&problem, NULL, &result))
00065         arrow_print_error("Could not solve TSP on file.\n");
00066     
00067     printf("\nFound Tour: %d\n", result.found_tour);
00068     printf("Tour length: %5.0f\n", result.obj_value);
00069     printf("Total Time: %5.2f\n", result.total_time);
00070     
00071     /* Free up the structures */
00072     arrow_tsp_result_destruct(&result);
00073     arrow_problem_destruct(&problem);
00074     
00075     return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00076 }
00077 
00078 void 
00079 print_help()
00080 {
00081     print_usage(program_name);
00082     printf("\n");
00083     printf("Runs the bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem on\n");
00084     printf("the given TSPLIB file.\n");
00085     printf("\n");
00086     printf("Options:\n");
00087     printf("  -h, --help                print this help, then exit\n");
00088     printf("  -V, --version             print version number, then exit\n");
00089     printf("\n");
00090     printf("Report bugs to <johnlr@gmail.com>.\n");
00091 }
00092 
00093 void 
00094 print_version()
00095 {
00096     printf("%s (Arrow TSP) 1.0\n", program_name);
00097     printf("(c) Copyright 2006-2008\n");
00098     printf("    John LaRusic, Eric Aubanel, and Abraham Punnen.\n");
00099     printf("\n");
00100     printf("This is free software.  You may redistribute copies of it\n");
00101     printf("under the terms of the GNU General Public License \n");
00102     printf("    <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>.\n");
00103     printf("There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.\n");
00104     printf("\n");
00105     printf("Written by John LaRusic.\n");
00106 }
00107 
00108 void 
00109 print_usage()
00110 {
00111     printf("Usage: %s [options] tsplib_file\n", program_name);
00112 }
00113 
00114 void 
00115 read_args(int argc, char *argv[])
00116 {
00117     int opt_idx;
00118     char opt;
00119     char *short_options = "hV";
00120     struct option long_options[] =
00121     {
00122         {"help", no_argument, 0, 'h'},
00123         {"version", no_argument, 0, 'V'}
00124     };
00125 
00126     while(1)
00127     {
00128         opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_options, long_options, &opt_idx);
00129         if(opt == -1) break;
00130         
00131         switch (opt)
00132         {
00133             case 'h':
00134                 print_help(argv[0]);
00135                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00136                 break;
00137             case 'V':
00138                 print_version(argv[0]);
00139                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00140                 break;
00141             default:
00142                 printf("Option: %c\n", opt);
00143                 print_usage(argv[0]);
00144                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00145         }
00146     }
00147     
00148     /* Read the file name to process */
00149     if(optind == argc)
00150     {
00151         arrow_print_error("No problem files specified.\n");
00152         print_usage(argv[0]);
00153         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00154     }
00155     else if(optind < argc - 1)
00156     {
00157         arrow_print_error("Multiple input files specified.\n");
00158         print_usage(argv[0]);
00159         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00160     }
00161     input_file = argv[optind];    
00162 }
